page.title: 10FARMING - SULLINGTON
page.content: Farming in Sullington is typified by the farmstead at the foot of the downs. Several acres of higher land have been reclaimed and are now included in fiftyeight percent crop producing land. The lower slopes provide grazing for cattle, mainly Fresian, but compared with former days there are few sheep. Rape seed oil is a new crop being tried. Full use is made of the latest types of tractor and combine harvesters. Horses are very much a thing of the past. Several farmers are seriously thinking of installing computers but problems are dealt with by the Ministry of Agriculture. Generally the farmers are not in favour of the Common Market, one comment being that the politician tends to think about sixty years ahead while the farmer is running a business today.
